title: Complete Prompt Engineering Masterclass
description: Master the art of prompt engineering from basics to advanced techniques. Learn to craft prompts that get exceptional results from any AI model.

lessons.title: What is a Prompt?
lessons.article: A prompt is an instruction or input given to an AI model to guide its response. In this lesson, you will learn the fundamentals of prompt design.
lessons.task: Write a simple prompt for a chatbot that asks for the weather.

lessons.title: Prompt Types
lessons.article: There are various types of prompts: instruction, role play, chain of thought, few shot, and zero shot. Each serves a different purpose.
lessons.task: List two differences between instruction and role play prompts.

lessons.title: Chain-of-Thought
lessons.article: Chain-of-thought prompting encourages the AI to reason step by step. This is useful for complex problem solving.
lessons.task: Write a prompt that asks the AI to solve a math problem step by step.

title: Creative Prompting for Writers, Artists & Storytellers
description: Unleash your creativity by using AI prompts for storytelling, visual art generation, character development, and world-building. Ideal for writers, designers, and creators.

lessons.title: Story Seeds & Openers
lessons.article: Learn to craft prompts that inspire unique stories, dialogues, and scenarios with emotional depth.
lessons.task: Write a prompt that generates a story starting with: 'The sky wasn't always this red...'

lessons.title: Generating Art with DALL·E
lessons.article: Use creative visual descriptions to generate original artwork using image-based AI tools.
lessons.task: Create a prompt for an artwork depicting 'a futuristic floating jungle city at sunset.'

lessons.title: Character Profiles
lessons.article: Design AI prompts that help you build deep, multidimensional characters with backstories and dialogue styles.
lessons.task: Create a prompt for a character who is a time-traveling chef with memory loss.

lessons.title: Interactive Storytelling
lessons.article: Build branching narratives and choose-your-own-adventure styles using AI decision prompts.
lessons.task: Write a prompt that allows the user to choose between two story paths in a magical forest.

title: No-Code AI Assistant Building with Prompt Design
description: Build your own AI-powered virtual assistant using ChatGPT and no-code tools like Zapier, Notion, and Make.com. Learn to structure prompts that automate workflows and personalize responses without writing code.

lessons.title: Understanding No-Code AI Tools
lessons.article: Learn how tools like ChatGPT, Zapier, and Make.com can be combined to create intelligent assistants without programming.
lessons.task: Describe a daily task you want to automate using an AI assistant.

lessons.title: Prompting for Automation
lessons.article: Design prompts that work as triggers and responses in automation workflows.
lessons.task: Create a prompt that responds to customer queries pulled from a Google Sheet.

lessons.title: Create a Branded AI Personality
lessons.article: Use persona-based prompting to give your assistant a consistent tone, role, and purpose.
lessons.task: Write a prompt for an assistant called Ava who speaks like a cheerful productivity coach.

lessons.title: Deploying Your AI Bot
lessons.article: Connect your AI assistant to tools like Telegram, Slack, or email with Zapier workflows.
lessons.task: Design a workflow where a customer question in Telegram triggers a reply from your assistant.

title: Persona-Based Prompting: Mastering the Roleplay Pattern
description: Learn to design powerful AI interactions using persona-based prompts. Use roleplay to simulate experts, coaches, fictional characters, and branded voices for more context-aware, creative, and user-friendly results.

lessons.title: What is a Persona Prompt?
lessons.article: A persona prompt tells the AI to act as someone or something — a role, profession, or personality. This helps guide the tone and style of responses.
lessons.task: Write a prompt where the AI acts as a patient English teacher for a 10-year-old student.

lessons.title: Consistency in Roleplay
lessons.article: Learn techniques to keep the AI consistently in character using constraints and memory cues.
lessons.task: Create a persona prompt for a sarcastic movie critic reviewing a new superhero film.

lessons.title: Simulating Experts & Mentors
lessons.article: Simulate the voice of a therapist, career coach, historian, or developer to create value-rich conversations.
lessons.task: Design a prompt where the AI acts as a DevOps coach guiding a student through CI/CD.

title: Chain-of-Thought Prompting: Teach AI to Reason Step-by-Step
description: Master the Chain-of-Thought (CoT) prompting technique to guide the AI through logical steps, structured explanations, and problem-solving workflows. Ideal for reasoning-heavy tasks.

lessons.title: What is CoT Prompting?
lessons.article: CoT prompting instructs the AI to explain its thinking process step-by-step, improving output quality for tasks like math, logic, and coding.
lessons.task: Write a prompt that guides the AI to solve a riddle by thinking aloud.

lessons.title: Why CoT Works
lessons.article: CoT improves performance by activating reasoning chains, especially in zero-shot or few-shot cases.
lessons.task: Rephrase a factual question as a step-by-step reasoning challenge.

lessons.title: Use CoT in Interviews, Code, and Analysis
lessons.article: Apply CoT to mock interviews, code debugging, financial analysis, and decision support.
lessons.task: Create a CoT prompt that walks through a debugging task in a Python function.

title: Rewriting, Editing, and Translating Prompts: The Refinement Pattern
description: Learn to use prompts that instruct the AI to rewrite, improve, translate, or simplify content. Ideal for writers, marketers, and multilingual tasks.

lessons.title: Rewriting for Clarity or Tone
lessons.article: Teach AI to modify a piece of content's tone, length, or audience-fit using structured instructions.
lessons.task: Prompt the AI to rewrite a formal paragraph into casual tone for Gen Z readers.

lessons.title: Proofreading & Grammar Prompts
lessons.article: Use refinement prompts to fix grammar, enhance style, and increase coherence.
lessons.task: Give a poorly written paragraph and prompt the AI to enhance it for clarity.

modules.title: AI as a Translator or Converter

lessons.title: Multilingual Prompting
lessons.article: Translate between languages or dialects using accurate refinement instructions.
lessons.task: Prompt the AI to convert English marketing copy into formal Japanese.

title: Prompt Tuning & Optimization: From Average to Expert
description: Learn how to fine-tune your prompts using a testing-feedback-improve loop. Understand the impact of small tweaks on output quality, tone, and logic.

lessons.title: Prompt Length, Framing, and Specificity
lessons.article: Even small edits to phrasing, detail, or order can dramatically change how AI responds.
lessons.task: Rewrite a vague prompt into a highly specific one for an AI writing assistant.

lessons.title: Building a Prompt Feedback Loop
lessons.article: Run structured A/B testing and make incremental changes to improve relevance or creativity.
lessons.task: Give two versions of the same prompt and compare AI outputs — which is better and why?

title: Prompt Debugging: Fixing Bad or Unclear Responses
description: Not getting the results you expect from your prompts? Learn how to analyze bad responses and fix prompt phrasing, logic, context, and formatting issues.

lessons.title: Vague vs Clear Inputs
lessons.article: Learn how vague wording, missing context, or overloaded prompts lead to poor results.
lessons.task: Fix a badly written prompt for a restaurant recommendation chatbot.

lessons.title: Chunking, Reordering, and Constraints
lessons.article: Break down complex prompts into manageable steps and use constraints to limit hallucination.
lessons.task: Rewrite a prompt to avoid off-topic or overly verbose AI responses.

title: Prompt Audit: Scoring, Ranking & Evaluating AI Outputs
description: Learn how to evaluate AI responses using rubrics for quality, accuracy, tone, creativity, and alignment. Create scoring frameworks to improve prompt reliability at scale.

lessons.title: Evaluation Criteria
lessons.article: Define what ‘good’ means for different use cases: precision, engagement, coherence, actionability.
lessons.task: Score 3 sample AI outputs using a rubric for tone and clarity.

lessons.title: Create a Feedback Pipeline
lessons.article: Use self-evaluation, AI self-critique, or user scoring to continuously refine prompts.
lessons.task: Write a prompt that asks the AI to critique and improve its own answer.
